help.title: About Lilt GUI
help.description: Lilt GUI is a modern cross-platform desktop application for managing lilt audio transcoding.
help.liltDescription: Lilt is a cross-platform command-line tool that converts Hi-Res FLAC and ALAC files to 16-bit FLAC files with a sample rate of 44.1kHz or 48kHz. It can also enforce output formats for all audio files to FLAC, MP3, or ALAC.
help.feature1: Convert Hi-Res FLAC/ALAC files to 16-bit FLAC
help.author: Author
help.authorInfo: Lilt and Lilt GUI are created by Arda Kılıçdağı. Visit

config.title: Configuration
config.externalTools: External Tools (Required when not using Docker)

tooltip.liltBinary: Path to the lilt executable. Required to run transcoding.
tooltip.soxBinary: Path to SoX binary. Required when not using Docker.
tooltip.soxNgBinary: Path to SoX-NG binary (alternative to SoX). Required when not using Docker.
tooltip.ffmpegBinary: Path to FFmpeg binary. Required for ALAC support and metadata preservation when not using Docker.
tooltip.ffprobeBinary: Path to FFprobe binary. Required for audio analysis when not using Docker.
tooltip.useDocker: Use Docker to run transcoding. Recommended for better cross-platform compatibility and no need to install external tools.
tooltip.outputFormat: Choose the output format for all audio files. Default mode intelligently detects and converts only Hi-Res files.
tooltip.noPreserveMetadata: Do not preserve ID3 tags and cover art. By default, metadata is preserved.
tooltip.copyImages: Copy JPG and PNG files from source to target directory.
tooltip.sourceDirectory: Directory containing the audio files to transcode.
tooltip.targetDirectory: Directory where transcoded files will be saved.
